Problem:
Consider a complex function \\(z(t) = e^{i\\omega t}\\) where \\(\\omega\\) is a real constant. The scenario investigates how the function's behavior changes under various transformations, particularly a transformation applied by an integral operator \\(T\\) defined by \\(Tf(t) = \\int_0^t e^{i\\alpha s} f(s) ds\\), where \\(\\alpha\\) is a fixed real constant.

If the integral operator \\(T\\) is applied to \\(z(t)\\) without any further manipulation, will the transformed function \\(Tz(t)\\) at time \\(t\\) solely depend on the initial function and not on the integral transformation parameters?
Explanation: The transformed function \\(Tz(t)\\) will be influenced by both the nature of the original function \\(z(t)\\) and the parameters of the transformation (\\(\\alpha\\) in this case). The integral operator significantly alters the output depending on its own structure, affecting the result at any given time \\(t\\).
